title: 112_s1657
content:
The Act is titled the "Sport Fish Restoration and Recreational Boating Safety Act of 2011." It amends the Federal Aid in Fish Restoration Act and addresses the division of annual appropriations. Section 4 (16 U.S.C. 777c) is amended to update funding allocations for fiscal years, with specific adjustments made for fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014. Section 4 (16 U.S.C. 777c) is amended to update funding allocations for fiscal years, with specific adjustments made for fiscal years 2012, 2013, and 2014. This includes transferring funds for boating safety purposes, such as $6,500,000 for section 13107(c) of title 46, United States Code, and $200,000 for the National Boating Safety Advisory Council. The amendment updates funding allocations for fiscal years, including $6,000,000 for national boating safety activities of nonprofit organizations. Amounts specified for a fiscal year cannot be included in the annual appropriation distributed under subsection (a) for that year. Subsection (b)(2)(B) is amended by changing "subsection (e)" to "subsection (c)." The amendment updates funding allocations for fiscal years, including $6,000,000 for national boating safety activities of nonprofit organizations. Subsection (e) is amended to adjust the maximum amount the Secretary of the Interior may use annually. The amendment adjusts the maximum amount the Secretary of the Interior may use annually based on the change in the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers. SEC. 4. Amendment to extend the exception to the limitation on transfers to fund until 2017.

SEC. 5. Amendments to recreational boating safety regulations, including reducing the number of required boats from two to 1.5 and increasing the funding limit from $5,500,000 to $6,500,000.
